description: Wordnik APIs let you request definitions from the The Century Dictionary, frequency data reflecting occurrences in our corpus, example sentences for words, spelling suggestions, word autocompletion, and words of the day, and more on the way.
steps: Browse to http://www.wordnik.com/users/edit to get your apiKey

blocks.name: listMyWordsLists
blocks.description: Fetches WordList objects for the logged-in user

args.name: limit
args.info: Maximum number of results to return

blocks.name: getMyApiTokenStatus
blocks.description: Returns usage statistics for the API account.

args.name: includeDuplicates
args.info: Show duplicate examples from different sources

args.name: useCanonical
args.info: If true will try to return the correct word root ('cats' -> 'cat'). If false returns exactly what was requested.

args.name: limit
args.info: Maximum number of results to return

blocks.name: getWordObject
blocks.description: Given a word as a string, returns the WordObject that represents this word

args.name: includeDuplicates
args.info: Show duplicate examples from different sources

args.name: useCanonical
args.info: If true will try to return the correct word root ('cats' -> 'cat'). If false returns exactly what was requested.

args.name: sourceDictionaries
args.info: Source dictionary to return definitions from. If 'all' is received, results are returned from all sources. If multiple values are received (e.g. 'century,wiktionary'), results are returned from the first specified dictionary that has definitions. If left blank, results are returned from the first dictionary that has definitions. By default, dictionaries are searched in this order: ahd, wiktionary, webster, century, wordnet

args.name: useCanonical
args.info: If true will try to return the correct word root ('cats' -> 'cat'). If false returns exactly what was requested.

args.name: includeTags
args.info: Return a closed set of XML tags in response

args.name: limit
args.info: Maximum number of results to return

blocks.name: getWordTopExample
blocks.description: Returns a top example for a word

args.name: useCanonical
args.info: If true will try to return the correct word root ('cats' -> 'cat'). If false returns exactly what was requested.

blocks.name: listWordRelatedWords
blocks.description: Given a word as a string, returns relationships from the Word Graph

args.name: useCanonical
args.info: If true will try to return the correct word root ('cats' -> 'cat'). If false returns exactly what was requested.

args.name: relationshipTypes
args.info: Limits the total results per type of relationship type

args.name: limitPerRelationshipType
args.info: Restrict to the supplied relationship types

blocks.name: getWordPronunciations
blocks.description: Returns text pronunciations for a given word

args.name: useCanonical
args.info: If true will try to return the correct word root ('cats' -> 'cat'). If false returns exactly what was requested.

args.name: limit
args.info: Maximum number of results to return

blocks.name: getWordHyphenation
blocks.description: Returns syllable information for a word

args.name: useCanonical
args.info: If true will try to return the correct word root ('cats' -> 'cat'). If false returns exactly what was requested.

args.name: limit
args.info: Maximum number of results to return

args.name: useCanonical
args.info: If true will try to return the correct word root ('cats' -> 'cat'). If false returns exactly what was requested.

blocks.name: listWordBigramPhrases
blocks.description: Fetches bi-gram phrases for a word

args.name: useCanonical
args.info: If true will try to return the correct word root ('cats' -> 'cat'). If false returns exactly what was requested.

args.name: limit
args.info: Maximum number of results to return

args.name: useCanonical
args.info: If true will try to return the correct word root ('cats' -> 'cat'). If false returns exactly what was requested.

blocks.name: getWordAudio
blocks.description: Fetches audio metadata for a word

args.name: useCanonical
args.info: If true will try to return the correct word root ('cats' -> 'cat'). If false returns exactly what was requested.

args.name: includePartOfSpeech
args.info: Only include this list of parts of speech

args.name: excludePartOfSpeech
args.info: Exclude this list of parts of speech

args.name: minDictionaryCount
args.info: Minimum number of dictionary entries for words returned

args.name: maxDictionaryCount
args.info: Maximum number of dictionary entries for words returned

args.name: limit
args.info: Maximum number of results to return

args.name: findSenseForWord
args.info: Restricts words and finds closest sense

args.name: includeSourceDictionaries
args.info: Only include this list of source dictionaries

args.name: excludePartOfSpeech
args.info: Exclude this list of source dictionaries

args.name: includeTags
args.info: Return a closed set of XML tags in response

args.name: limit
args.info: Maximum number of results to return

args.info: Only include this list of parts of speech

args.name: minDictionaryCount
args.info: Minimum number of dictionary entries for words returned

args.info: Maximum number of dictionary entries for words returned
